Sequence Information.Peptide Name: HFIAP-1 (natural AMPs; hagfish cathelicidin, fish, animals; XXH, UCLL1. Also HFIAP-2 )

Literature Information.Literature: W7 and W32 are brominated. Active against Gram+ bacteria P. acnes ATCC 11827 and 33179, S.  epidermidi, S. pyogenes, E. faecium, S.  aureus ATCC 29213, C. perfringens ATCC 9081 and 13124, E. faecalis (MIC 2-32 uM); Gram- bacteria Bacteroides spp. ATCC 29771, 43935, and 12290, S. sonnei, S. maltophilia, Salmonella Group B, P. aeruginosa ATCC 27853, A. baumannii, E. coli ATCC 25922, E.  aerogenes, E.  cloacae, K. pneumoniae (MIC 0.5-16). HFIAP-2 is identical to HFIAP-1 in terms of amino acid sequence. However, HFIAP-2 is only brominated at residue W7.  Updated 10/2014; 12/2019.
Literature Information.Author: Uzzell T, Stolzenberg ED, Shinnar AE, Zasloff M2003
Literature Information.Title: Hagfish intestinal antimicrobial peptides are ancient cathelicidins
